title: Frontend-only static React/Vite conversion for Netlify (remove IC runtime dependencies)

requirements.summary: Make the app run and build as a standalone static frontend without any required IC backend artifacts.
acceptanceCriteria: The `backend/` canister code is removed from the build/deploy flow (no backend canister is required to run or deploy the site).
IC/dfx-specific deployment configuration is removed or clearly separated so a Netlify deploy can run without installing/using dfx.
A clean Netlify build completes successfully using only the frontend build output (no backend artifacts required).

file_operations.description: Switch the bootstrapped module script away from the IC/Internet-Identity-based entry to the new static-only entry so the built site no longer depends on IC runtime initialization.
Add a static-only React bootstrap entry that mounts the app using only frontend-safe providers (e.g., React Query + App) and does not import/use Internet Identity or actor wiring.
Remove the runtime dependency on backend actor submission hooks from the Contact form so the production bundle can build/run without backend artifacts.

requirements.summary: Remove Internet Identity and actor initialization from runtime by booting the app from a new static-only entry file (without touching immutable files).
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/index.html` boots the app from a new static-only entry file (e.g., a new `frontend/src/main.static.tsx`), so `frontend/src/main.tsx` remains untouched.
The running site no longer requires Internet Identity to initialize (no II login flow is needed and no II-related runtime initialization blocks rendering).
No calls to create/use an IC backend actor are required for any user-visible page to load and function as before (visually unchanged).

file_operations.description: Update the entry script reference from `frontend/src/main.tsx` to `frontend/src/main.static.tsx` while keeping the rest of the document (meta tags, icons, root node) unchanged.

Implement a static-only app bootstrap that renders the existing `App` with the same non-auth providers needed for the UI, and does not import `InternetIdentityProvider`, `useInternetIdentity`, `useActor`, or any IC-specific config.

requirements.summary: Convert the Contact form submission to a frontend-only static behavior with in-app success/failure messaging and no backend calls, keeping UI unchanged and English copy.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the contact form performs no backend/actor/canister request and does not require Internet Identity.
The Contact page renders the same form UI (fields and layout remain), and submission gives a clear in-app confirmation message in English.
The app builds and runs on Netlify with the Contact page usable without any backend.

file_operations.description: Replace `useSubmitContactForm` mutation usage with local-only submission handling (client-side only), preserving existing form fields, layout, and existing English success/error alert text; maintain a visually equivalent loading/disabled state for the submit button without making any actor/canister requests.

requirements.summary: Add Netlify SPA deployment configuration (build/publish + route redirects) so deep links refresh correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: A Netlify deploy configuration exists (e.g., `netlify.toml`) with the correct build command and publish directory for the Vite build output.
An SPA redirect rule exists (e.g., `frontend/public/_redirects` with `/* /index.html 200`) so deep links work on Netlify.
Refreshing any app route on Netlify returns the app (not a 404).

file_operations.description: Add a Netlify configuration suitable for deploying this Vite SPA from the `frontend/` base directory, defining the correct build command and publish directory for the static output.
Add an SPA redirect rule so any route (including deep links like /about, /solutions, /contact) serves the app entry document on refresh/direct navigation.

requirements.summary: Preserve the visible UI/appearance during the frontend-only conversion, changing only what is necessary to remove backend-only behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Header, footer, Home, About, Solutions, and Contact pages render with the same layout and styling as before the conversion.
Any user-facing text introduced or modified during the conversion remains in English.
No new authentication UI or backend-related UI is added.

file_operations.description: Ensure the static-only bootstrap maintains the same top-level rendering behavior (same App tree and global styles import pattern) so the site’s appearance remains unchanged while removing Internet Identity initialization.

Keep the Contact form’s existing shadcn/ui-based layout and styling intact while removing backend submission logic; ensure any new/modified UI messaging remains in English and no authentication-related UI is introduced. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
